name: Future Wars
description: Battle it out on the proving grounds and get ready for Future Wars. Similar to classic titles such as Advance Wars and Battle Isle, the game takes strategy gaming away from the micro-management overkill that it has become and using simple, proven rock-paper-scissors principles, reopens the genre to everyone.

reviews.review_text: This game seemed to be interesting, but sadly failed on so many levels. Having been compared to Advance Wars, I was expecting a lot more out of the game than it gave me.  The plot was uninspiring, the characters at least as much. The art, animations and unit design also leads much to be desired. Complemented with bugs, and a lack of other Advance Wars features mean that even Hot Seat and Editing fail to make this enjoyable and engaging.  Much regret on my part for buying this game...

Future Wars is a turn-based strategy game where you build units to destroy your opponents' armies and capture their headquarters, much like Advance Wars. In fact, it's so much like Advance Wars that it falls in the 'blatant ripoff' category. The formula is the same, the strategy is the same, even the maps are the same. The only difference is the design, where the bright and distinct pixel art is replaced by 3D models that all look the same. What I saw of the story was stupid and pointless.  The games in the Advance Wars series are wonderful strategy games. Sadly, Future Wars just doesn't quite live up to the game it emulates. If you think you might be interested, get a DS or a much cheaper GBA and buy any version of Advance Wars.
